TopicTitle: ISRU with seat for the engineer--finally, a use for the old Mk1 cockpit IVA!

Articles.Content:
I made this in response to a question posted by Xyphos--pilots have a special place to sit (all the various command modules), and so do scientists (the MPL) But what about engineers?

Here's your answer--Kerbfleet Engineering proudly presents the ISRUK (In Situ Resource Unit, Krewed). It weighs 250 kilos more than the stock ISRU and fits one Kerbal but does not function as a command module. It also has no hatch; you'll have to get in and out of it by crew transfer, or load the engineer in the SPH/VAB. The IVA view is the same as the old 0.90 Mk1 Inline Cockpit--which in this context, finally makes sense!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Kerbfleet not responsible for damage to ships or crew due to ethanol poisoning.

Part is available here on Dropbox, I think if you make an ISRUK folder with those three files in it anywhere in GameData it should work.

Edited August 8, 2015 by Kuzzter
First! Nice mod, it is quite good looking on the Kerbfleet shelf.
